DOC.brief_summary: Intervention coronary bifurcation lesion 10~20 % entire percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) . Bifurcation lesion difficult treat prognosis PCI bifurcation lesion poorer compare non-bifurcation lesion . Furthermore , occlusion side branch frequently occur PCI . Several technique prevent occlusion side branch develop , outcomes satisfied . H-side branch stent develop treat coronary side branch lesion compose proximal , connect distal part . In vivo study perform pig show effective H-side branch stent . This study confirm safety efficacy H-side branch stent treatment coronary side branch lesion .
DOC.brief_title: H-Side Branch Stent , A New Stent Treatment True Bifurcation Lesions
DOC.criteria: Older 20 year old Patient angina asymptomatic ischemic cardiomyopathy require treated stent coronary bifurcation lesion Bifurcation lesion 2.5~4.0mm main vessel diameter , < 30mm main vessel length ≥2.0mm branch vessel diameter Acute myocardial infarction Confirmed suspicious presence thrombus target lesion Instent restenosis lesion Visual angulation ≥75° Lesion severe calcification severe tortuosity Left main lesion Chronic total occlusion lesion Graft lesion Contraindication antiplatelet drug Left ventricular dysfunction ( LVEF ≤40 % ) Severe hepatic dysfunction ( ≥2.5 time reference AST ALT ) Renal dysfunction ( serum Creatinine > 2.0mg/dL ) History cerebral hemorrhage , pulmonary gastrointestinal bleeding Hypersensitivity aspirin , clopidogrel contrast medium Pregnant woman possibility pregnancy clinical study period
